alert.note: Alert for Central Carbon County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; North Snowy Range Foothills; Shirley Basin; Sierra Madre Range; Snowy Range; Southwest Carbon County; Upper North Platte River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 10:41PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Carbon County through 1145 PM MDT... At 1041 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles northeast of Creston Junction, or 15 miles west of Rawlins, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Rawlins, Saratoga, Hanna, Encampment, Baggs, Sinclair, Elk Mountain, Dixon, Grand Encampment, Battle Lake, Muddy Gap, Haskins Creek Campground, Teton Reservoir, Seminoe Dam, Savery, Ryan Park Campground, Separation Lake, Lost Creek Campground, Little Sandstone Creek Campground and Bottle Creek Campground. This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 200 and 263. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.

area.areaDesc: Central Carbon County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; North Snowy Range Foothills; Shirley Basin; Sierra Madre Range; Snowy Range; Southwest Carbon County; Upper North Platte River Basin
